title: Four Seasons Hotel Amman welcomes Thai chef Suwattana Boonyarattanusorn
text:
Four Seasons Hotel Amman welcomes Thai chef Suwattana Boonyarattanusorn
Four Seasons Hotel Amman welcomes Thai Chef Suwattana Boonyarattanusorn, who is coming to Jordan from Four Seasons Resort Chiang Mai in Thailand, and is renowned for his unique home-made Northern Thai recipes that are generally prepared with curry spices and Chiang Mai peppercorns.
Chef Suwattana, 33 years old, is the Assistant Chef Instructor at Four Seasons Resort Chiang Mai, where he manages the Cooking School and the Chef’s Table. He will be sharing his northern Thai recipes with city and Hotel guests alike for the next three months. Guests can enjoy Chef Suwattana’s dishes at Asia Restaurant every day for lunch and dinner. For a novel way to learn even more about one of the world’s favourite cuisines, he will be providing interactive private cooking classes for Hotel guests and diners to witness the creation of his northern Thai cuisine first hand.
Chef Suwattana stated, “Each region in Thailand is famous for its own cooking style and I think that is interesting because we are actually using almost the same ingredients but just a little twist can make the taste different. I’m really looking forward to sharing my twists and tastes of northern Thai cuisine with our Hotel and city guests.”
Asia is located on the first floor of the Hotel in Amman and sets a new standard of quality and excellence as one of the Kingdom’s specialised Thai restaurants. In addition to contemporary Thai, Four Seasons Hotel Amman has created imaginative and acclaimed restaurants to cater to a variety of tastes, including Levant cuisine at Olea, classic Italian cuisine at Vivace, light fare at The Foyer Lounge, the intimate Square Bar, and the inviting outdoor ambiance of FIVE Grill & Lounge, which is open in the summer.
Source:-Four Seasons.
